introduction.name: Hong Pei
introduction.blurb: I'm a software engineer with a passion for building thoughtful, practical solutions through code. On the main page, you'll find my resume, which gives a snapshot of my background and experience. Feel free to explore and see some of the projects I've worked on — each one has taught me something new and helped me grow. Thanks for taking the time to visit!

details: Built pipelining use-cases in the insurance context on Palantir's AI Platform to optimise data triage and unification workflows, saving client data engineers time in ingesting and processing tabular data.
Demonstrated product features and worked with clients to integrate new product features in current workflows.
Developed a product enhancement to visualise product installations in week-long Hack Week
Conducted full clean-up of React front-end styles and subsequently implemented dark mode.
Refactored and migrated benchmark data pipeline to improve performance and enrich data.
Led end-to-end deployments, working closely with users for requirements gathering and acceptance testing, and developers for operational support.
Implemented monitoring filters in Spring Gateway to track metrics to better support user requests.
Integrated Prometheus alerts with Grafana dashboard to monitor application health and usage.
Assisted in development of translation tool in React frontend to streamline language support.

experiences.company: School of Computing, National University of Singapore
details: Conducted Data Structures and Algorithms laboratory sessions for two semesters to teach students to use data structures and algorithms in Java.
Assisted in invigilating examinations and grading student assignments.
Undertook project on multilingual information retrieval, a specialised aspect of machine learning in natural language processing.
Developed search tool on React with backend in Flask to interface results in an accessible manner.

education.degree: Master of Science in Engineering and Technology Innovation Management (MS ETIM)
Bachelor of Computing in Information Systems (BComp IS)
details: Specialisation in Financial Technology ⬩ Minor in Economics ⬩ USP/NUS College
Honours: AY20/21 Semester 1 Dean's List ⬩ AY20/21 USP Honour Roll ⬩ AY22/23 NUS College Recognition Award

projects.title: EZProperty
projects.subtitle: Data Engineering with Airflow
projects.label: Repo
projects.text: A data engineering project that parses data from HDB, URA, and other third party data sources to understand applications of data in the commercial housing market.

projects.title: iORA Integrated Enterprise System
projects.subtitle: Information Systems Capstone Project
projects.label: Repo
projects.text: An enterprise system designed to digitise and streamline iORA Fashion's Enterprise Resource Planning, Point-of-Sales and Customer Relationship Management sytems.

projects.title: iORA E-Commerce System
projects.subtitle: Information Systems Capstone Project
projects.label: Repo
projects.text: An e-commerce system integrated with the iORA Enterprise System, providing customers with a seamless experience while shopping on iORA's online store.

projects.title: MulLing
projects.subtitle: Multilingual Information Retrieval Project
projects.label: Repo
projects.text: A toolkit to evaluate Information Retrieval Methods in a multilingual setting, providing a platform for initiating a self-trained NLP model referencing Facebook's MUSE.

misc.title: Developing, Applications
misc.subtitle: Critical Reflection Portfolio
misc.label: Portfolio
misc.text: A portfolio reflecting upon my learning in Information Systems and the University Scholars Programme (USP)/NUS College.

misc.title: NUS College Breakaway Visualiser
misc.subtitle: Design Tool
misc.label: Widget
misc.text: A simple visualiser to render NUS College's Breakaway text with reference to NUS College design guidelines.

misc.title: House Sorter
misc.subtitle: Colouring Algorithm
misc.label: Repo
misc.text: A simple colouring algorithm for sorting freshmen/first-years into houses referencing data from their faculties, schools, etc.
